main_text:
Naturalness and other notions
4. Naturalness and other notions

Lewis
 (1983)
 argues for the theoretical utility of the notion of naturalness by
proposing an array of generalizations linking naturalness to other
topics, including similarity, intrinsicness, materialism, laws of
nature, and meaning. Subsequent authors have offered competing or
complementary proposals. Many proposals, like Lewis’s, purport
to “analyse”, or provide necessary and sufficient
conditions for, some other property partly in terms of naturalness;
some purport to analyse naturalness in terms of other properties;
others involve other kinds of generalizations. This section will
attempt a survey.
hierarchy_title: Natural Properties || Naturalness and other notions
